question: Which one of following is Polysaccharide vaccine:-
exp: Polysaccharide vaccines are: Typhim-Vi Pneumococcal vaccine Meningococcal vaccine Hib.
topic_name: Concepts of Immunity, Classification of Vaccines

question: Injectable tetanus toxoid (TT ) is an example of:
exp: The toxins produced by organisms such as Diptheria & Tetanus are detoxicated and used in preparation of Vaccines (Toxoids). This detoxified toxins when administered in the body can elicit immune response resulting in antibody production & memory. The Antibodies produced neutralize the toxic moeity produced during infection by these organisms thus providing active immunization to the body. Active Immunity Passive Immunity Definition Include humoral and cellular responses of host Results in Ab production in the body. Formed by transfer of ready made antibodies Host body does not produce its own Ab. Modes of acquiring Following clinical infection, subclinical/ inapparent infection or immunization with an Ag. Administering Ig / antiserum or transplacental transfer of Ab/ Transfer of lymphocytes.
topic_name: Concepts of Immunity, Classification of Vaccines

question: Which of the following is called 'first immunization' of the baby?
exp: COLOSTRUM: Is the most suitable food immediately after bih of the baby; Regular milk comes 3-6 days after bih Aka 'Beestings', 'First milk' or 'Immune Milk'. High in carbohydrates, proteins, antibodies & low in fat Contain all five immunoglobulins found in all mammals, IgA (highest), IgD, IgE, IgG & IgM Known as 'first immunization' of newborn Energy 55 Kcal/100 ml Proteins 2 g/100 ml
opb: Handing over the baby to mother
topic_name: Concepts of Immunity, Classification of Vaccines

question: BCG vaccine is diluted with:
exp: Lyophilized vaccines & their diluents: BCG vaccine - Normal saline Yellow fever vaccine - cold saline Japanese Encephalitis - phosphate buffer saline HiB - DPT / saline Measles, MMR - Distilled /sterile water
topic_name: Concepts of Immunity, Classification of Vaccines

question: HPV vaccine is:
exp: Currently two Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) vaccines are available in India as a protection against cervical cancer Gardasil vaccine: HPV types 6, 11, 16, 18 (Quadrivalent) Cervarix vaccine: HPV types 16, 18 (Bivalent)
topic_name: Concepts of Immunity, Classification of Vaccines

question: All are Live vaccines except:-
exp: - Rabies is a killed vaccine. Hence option-1 is wrong. - Influenza vaccine can be live attenuated, killed as well as subunit vaccine.
topic_name: Concepts of Immunity, Classification of Vaccines

question: Due to a measles outbreak within a community, a 7 month old male child was vaccinated for measles. what should be done next when the child comes for routine immunization?
exp: Vaccine can be given to a child between 6-9 months old during measles epidemic as till 6 months maternal antibodies provide immunity. For infants immunized during epidemic, a second dose should be administered as soon as possible after the child reaches the age of 9 months provided that at least 4 weeks have elapsed since the last dose
opa: Give a second dose after 6 weeks.
opb: Give a second dose as soon as he reaches 9 months of age.
opc: Give the second dose of measles at 16 months of age
opd: Give the second dose of measles at 12 months of age.
topic_name: Concepts of Immunity, Classification of Vaccines

question: True regarding SA-14-14-2 Japanese Encephalitis vaccine:
exp: - SA 14-14-2 vaccine of JE: Live attenuated cell-culture derived vaccine. - 2 doses of JE Live vaccine: First dose : 9-12 months. Second dose =16-24 months. Gives protection for 11 years - Nakayama, Beijing P3 are strains of killed JE vaccine - EXTRA-EDGE: DIFFERENT VACCINES & THEIR STRAINS VACCINE STRAIN BCG Danish 1331 OPV P1, P2, P3 Measles Edmonston zagreb, schwarez, Moraten Mumps Jeryll Lynn Rubella RA 27/3 Yellow fever 17D Varicella Oka H1N1 A7/ California/2009 Rabies fixed viral strain Anthrax Sterne strain
topic_name: Concepts of Immunity, Classification of Vaccines

question: Neonatal tetanus prevention is best done by_____________antenatal measure :
exp: - Neonatal tetanus can be prevented by giving: Primigravida - 2 doses of td as soon as possible. Multigravida- If pregnancy occurs within 3 years of 1st pregnancy -1 dose of td booster is given. If pregnancy occurs after 3yrs of 1st pregnancy- 2doses should be repeated.
topic_name: Concepts of Immunity, Classification of Vaccines

question: Active and passive immunity should be given together in all except:
exp: - Measles vaccine efficacy is reduced by concurrent administration of measles immunoglobulin. - Measles vaccine alone gives quite good (immunity) level of protection. - Hence we avoid giving Measles Immunoglobulin alongwith measles vaccine. - For tetanus, rabies & Hep B vaccination & Ig can be given together.
topic_name: Concepts of Immunity, Classification of Vaccines
